html.p: This app has several sample data files, but also relies on our datagen, to get regular repeating data (just like your SE uses to demo). Setting it up is pretty straightforward!
This should not be installed on your live Splunk install. Toss it on a laptop, or put a lab server up. Use the free license.
To set this up, we will need to install several apps:

ul.li: Bro IDS (Splunk Inc Owned Version) - https://splunkbase.splunk.com/app/1617/

html.p: Also make sure you install the CIM and EventGen, so you can take advantage of those things:
This app has several static data files, that are disabled for the sake of safety. Go enable them: /manager/security_ninjitsu/datainputstats.
By default, the data models shipped with CIM are not accelerated. Go Accelerate them, by clicking on the below links, and then clicking "Edit -> Edit Acceleration."

There is backfill functionality in the eventgen, but I need to find out how to make it work. I tried to provide pre-built log files for the use cases that I knew would require days of data (e.g., privileged user management), but that doesn't necessarily cover everything, so you may have to wait at least a few minutes or an hour before you have enough data.
